# Related publications

This page gives references to publications on the topics and themes of our book.
Some of these were written as the book was being developed; others reflect topics
or aspects that fell to the cutting room floor in editing.

Friendly, M. and Andrews, RJ (2021). [The radiant diagrams of Florence Nightingale.](https://raco.cat/index.php/SORT/article/view/388809).
SORT 45 (1) January-June 2021, 3-18. DOI: 10.2436/20.8080.02.106.  

* Friendly, M. and Les Chevaliers (2020). [Raiders of the Lost Tombs: The Search for Some Heroes of the History of Data Visualization.](https://medium.com/nightingale/raiders-of-the-lost-tombs-the-search-for-some-heroes-of-the-history-of-data-visualization-c4a4b4690d24)

* Friendly, M. (2021). [Minard Day 2021: Resources, Research, and Inspirations.](https://medium.com/nightingale/minard-day-2021-resources-research-and-inspirations-5588e4e6dbe9)  

* Friendly, M. (2021). [A Gleam in the Mind’s Eye: Stories and Lessons from the History of Data Visualization.](https://www.datavis.ca/papers/SSC2021-talk.pdf) Invited presentation, Statistical Society of Canada, June 2021.

* Friendly, M & Wainer, H. (2019). [Visual Thinking and Graphic Discoveries.](https://medium.com/@michael.friendly/visual-thinking-graphic-discoveries-128468677592)

* Friendly, M & Wainer, H. (2020). [Galton’s Gleam: Visual Thinking & Graphic Discoveries, _Significance_, **17**(3), 28-33, June 2020.](https://rss.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/1740-9713.01403)

* Wainer, H. (2017). [The Birth of Statistical Graphics and their European Childhood: On the historical development of W.E.B. Du Bois’ graphical narrative of a people, _Chance_, **30**(3), 61-67.](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/09332480.2017.1383117)

* Wainer, H., Friendly, M. & P. Millán-Martinez (2015). [Graphs ‘R Us: A discussion of Antony Unwin’s Graphical Data Analysis with R. _Journal of Educational and Behavioral Statistics_, **40**(6), 665-670](https://www.jstor.org/stable/43966405)
